phonebook.supported_filetypes package¶

Submodules¶

filetypes.py¶

This module contains the subclasses for serialization of formats (reading to and writing from) All subclasses inherits the phonebook.supported_filetypes.filetypes_abstract() as an abstract class.

class phonebook.supported_filetypes.filetypes.PhoneBookCSV[source]¶

Bases: phonebook.supported_filetypes.filetypes_abstract.PhoneBookABC

filetype¶
read_from(file_input)[source]¶

Method that takes a file object to read from and creates a dictionary that PhoneBookActions can accept

file_input takes a file object to read from

return: (list) python dictionary in phoneBook format

write_to(file_output, phone_book)[source]¶

Method for writing the phonebook dictionary to the specified filetype format

file_output takes a file object to write to

phone_book (dict) phone book

returns: (str) string in specified format

class phonebook.supported_filetypes.filetypes.PhoneBookJSON[source]¶

Bases: phonebook.supported_filetypes.filetypes_abstract.PhoneBookABC

phonebook.supported_filetypes.filetypes.query_filetypes()[source]¶

filetypes_abstract.py¶

This module contains the abstract class which all subclasses from phonebook.supported_filetypes.filetypes() When adding support for additional storage formats, you must inherit from this class and use it as a template.

class phonebook.supported_filetypes.filetypes_abstract.PhoneBookABC[source]¶

Bases: object

filetype¶

string Returns file extension of phonebook format e.g. ‘json’
